title: Since Lyte is gone, can we have soloq back?

replies.body:
Wait, Lyte's gone?

FUCK ALL YOU BASTARDS!!!
...don't tell lyte.
Yeah, when did this happen?
Earlier today.
Couples days ago*
Yesterday*
27 hours and 34 minutes ago*
99,240 seconds ago*

They*
Fixed.
Lyte was involved in any dq decisions, so no. probably not.

> [{quoted}](name=disregardable,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2AmvGsuh,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-10T11:02:54.899+0000)
>
> Lyte was involved in any dq decisions, so no. probably not.

Lyte was in charge of the social aspect of playing. He was posting the updates about dynamic queue. 

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/XvqbAgrF-letos-talk-about-dynamic-queues-and-ranked-play

Even the most controversial one, "soloq is coming 2 weeks =T"

So yes, Lyte was the responsible (80~90%) for dynamic queue
See here's where you're wrong. Dq would have been a massive decision, and would not have been down to just lyte. That is a decision that would have been made by at least 10 people.
But Lyte was the lead Person, so he had the final say on it.
Nope the decision would have been made by a group of people. Lyte was the lightning rod

> [{quoted}](name=billxx,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2AmvGsuh,comment-id=00000000000100000000,timestamp=2016-05-10T17:19:18.819+0000)
>
> Lytening rod
Lol I should have had that

One single employee is not responsible for being in charge of such a huge aspect of the game in such a company. Lyte is merely a forefront to all this. For all we know he could have had NOTHING to do with Dyn Q, he just was told to be the public "head" for it and release news given to him by higher ups BECAUSE he has credibility and connection to the social aspect of playing; thus players are more likely to listen to him when he says "Listen guys Dyn Q is a good idea and you should try it out!" They probably assumed everyone would fall in love with Dynamic Queue and would never dream of touching or thinking of Solo Q again.
Well Team Builder was the prototype for DQ.
*professor umbridge walks in

> [{quoted}](name=Light24o1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2AmvGsuh,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-10T23:16:07.783+0000)

Don't have mobitlity? Here, get this protobelt.
Need more burst? Why not protobelt?
Tanky? Get ROA since you are losing lane.

See graves. He's the perfect example of it.

Seriously? You're complaining about that? You're complaining about mages having more options in their builds to emphasize or to make up for a strength/weakness? An item isn't going to give a mage everything, and even is it "did", you'd still need to work your ass of for gold for those items.

> [{quoted}](name=Light24o1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2AmvGsuh,comment-id=000300000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-11T00:00:42.720+0000)

When you can just patchup your your weakness or remove counterplay there is little to no reason to design more champions.

so remove items from the game

that's basically what you're saying. That means Mercurial/QSS, Hexdrinker, Zhonya, Sterak's, Mikael's, Locket, etc shouldn't exist because they counter certain abilities/remove counterplay by protecting their user? I don't think immobile mages gaining a 200 range dash that doesn't go over walls and is attached to a **60 AP item** is a problem when Mercurial Scimitar gives 75 damage, lifesteal, and a better QSS cleanse.

Do people really think that because Lyte left they'll automatically undo everything that was related to him
that's not how business,or the world in general works
i am so glad about this news, finaly the beast is gone maybe league will become fun again now.

> [{quoted}](name=Hawkefire,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2AmvGsuh,comment-id=00020001000200000000,timestamp=2016-05-12T02:33:54.113+0000)
>
> And honestly, I don't think it helped WoW one bit.

Agreed.
And considering Ghostcrawler's distaste towards "easy, faceless matchmaking" and clear bias for premades, DQ isn't going anywhere and SQ is likely never coming.

> [{quoted}](name=ForeverLaxx,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2AmvGsuh,comment-id=000200010001,timestamp=2016-05-10T19:12:05.871+0000)
>
> And considering Ghostcrawler's distaste towards "easy, faceless matchmaking" and clear bias for premades, DQ isn't going anywhere and SQ is likely never coming.

While I do believe that there is somethingn that can be salvaged from DQ, I do think there needs to be some change.

On the topic of what's happening (with ADCs). People (ex-wow players) literally told us that ghostcrawler would do this. Now we see the majority of ADCs stronger than any melee is. While I like the ADC reworks, I really do wish that the balance of the game would have less of a bias towards ADCs. The only time they change up ADCs is when (a) a single adc is dominating, (b) LCS is getting bori- I mean the meta is getting stale, and (c) when they're about to become balanced as a class and not utterly broken OP.

All I was saying is that I wasn't surprised that Dynamic Queue, in it's current form, was embraced so heavily and readily by Riot once Ghostcrawler showed up. I've said this before in many other places, but he's gone on record multiple times that he hated the Dungeon Finder Tool and Raid Finder Tool in WoW because he viewed these systems as a "consequence-free group system". He liked to hide behind the reason that it removed some amount of the social aspect, but it always came back around to him stating that these systems allowed people to quit without real consequence. His preferred way was for you to get a bunch of friends and run things together, since that was the "spirit" of the genre and it followed, at least to him, that it was the ideal way to play. He ended up leaving WoW before he could do anything to those systems he hates, but in League he showed up just in time to be an influence.

This is why DQ currently punishes solo players and rewards those who queue together. He wants us to play League in the "ideal" or "best" way, and this time around, he can actually institute disincentives to going into Dynamic as a solo player. Of course, in true Ghostcrawler fashion, he's swung the pendulum as hard as he could in the opposite direction, so in some cases even your friends aren't "good enough" to queue with (evidenced by many threads of Gold-level people having to choose between playing with their Silver- OR Platinum-level friends, but not both). And, the previously promised SoloQueue, if it ever comes, has already been stated to be void of rewards.

Riot, and Ghostcrawler, don't want Solo players playing their game anymore. They've attached themselves to this fantasy that everyone should be on teams, or clubs, like we're all professional players living in a gaming house while be breathe, eat, and sleep League of Legends. Anyone who isn't part of this pipedream is just getting in the way.
yeah ... u are damn right ... damnit  another beast have to go before league become great again !!!

> [{quoted}](name=PbJMpP4xzk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2AmvGsuh,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2016-05-10T18:39:49.746+0000)
>
> yeah ... u are damn right ... damnit  another beast have to go before league become great again !!!

Which is funny cause people were telling Riot that Ghostcrawler wasn't wanted long ago, yet they went through with it anyway.

yeah like we were not aware that is an habit for riot to go through anything we dislike anyway and then telling us that the majority of the player base love it without any factual numbers about it how logical that sound.

> [{quoted}](name=PbJMpP4xzk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2AmvGsuh,comment-id=00020001000000000001,timestamp=2016-05-11T13:16:01.824+0000)
>
> yeah like we were not aware that is an habit for riot to go through anything we dislike anyway and then telling us that the majority of the player base love it without any factual numbers about it how logical that sound.

It's just that Ghostcrawler is behind a lot of that crap too.
Whats the Issue with Ghostcrawler again?

> [{quoted}](name=Light24o1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2AmvGsuh,comment-id=00020001000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-11T00:01:38.497+0000)
>
> Whats the Issue with Ghostcrawler again?

The Lord of Ranged, and hater of melee, responsible for huge losses on the part of the previous company he worked for, WoW, for exactly the same reason. 

His balancing tactics also absolutely ignore what the players think should be done, even when Riot and he don't know what they're doing. You could also attribute Riot's stubborn refusal to revert nerfs/buffs to him as well.

I don't know much of WoW, other than my own personal opinions, but "He ignores what players think should be done" sounds just terrible, and not because of Ghostcrawler. 

It sounds terrible because if we balanced around what players wanted, Zed, Lee, Yasou and Riven would become nerfed to the ground because a good majority of the playerbase is below Gold. Sure, we love it when our thoughts are shared with the balance team when it comes to nerfing someone, but they do not balance the game around the idea of the playerbase. 

Final personal opinion, they don't revert nerfs/buffs, because they also change other things around that time as well. Ask any good Sion player, and he'll say that Sion is good, or even great, atm because they've learned how to play with him effectively, despite half the community loops him in with being "Sejuani'd". Even Sejuani isn't as bad as people say she is because the people who truly play her, understand what it means to play her, and how to play her effectively. 

But by reverting a nerf/buff, while things have changed in the game, especially has the chance to bring back Old problems. People don't see it that way, because they think that the only buffs there are, are actual numbers to a champion. They don't look at other item nerfs or buffs to help look at other champions, even when those items aren't used on them.

Look at all the tank changes that have gone through. Look at all the Tank Ekkos, Talons, and other abusers that have started using tank items, and tell me that the actual tanks have not benefitted from those changes as well. To revert a nerf when those changes have been put in, only leads to a champion gaining unnecessary power.

I'd also invite you to look over this old Post
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4801581&page=1
